content: How can I change the background color of the 3 axes grid planes in a matplotlib 3D plot? I am referring to the scatterplot example of matplotlib and I want to set the background color to white while keeping the grid lines with the default gray color. I tried the solution provided in a previous question (https://stackoverflow.com/questions/9215512/how-do-i-change-the-color-of-the-axes-of-a-matplotlib-3d-plot) but I couldn't apply it to the example.

To change the background color of the 3D axes grid planes in a Matplotlib 3D plot while keeping the grid lines with their default color, you need to adjust the face color of the axis panes. Here is how you can do it using matplotlib:

```python
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import numpy as np
from mpl_toolkits.mplot3d import Axes3D

# Create some data
x = np.random.rand(100)
y = np.random.rand(100)
z = np.random.rand(100)

# Create a 3D scatter plot
fig = plt.figure()
ax = fig.add_subplot(111, projection='3d')

ax.scatter(x, y, z)

# Set the background color of each axis pane to white
ax.xaxis.pane.set_facecolor('white')
ax.yaxis.pane.set_facecolor('white')
ax.zaxis.pane.set_facecolor('white')

# Optionally, set the edge color of each pane to match the grid color
ax.xaxis.pane.set_edgecolor('gray')
ax.yaxis.pane.set_edgecolor('gray')
ax.zaxis.pane.set_edgecolor('gray')

# Show the plot
plt.show()
```

This code sets the face color of the panes to white while maintaining the default grid line color. Note that this approach works with Matplotlib's 3D plotting capabilities and should meet your requirement of keeping the grid lines while changing the background color of the grid planes.
